intro: Heleogiton compressa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, tubular flowers that are typically purple or blue in color. The plant produces a distinctive, fragrant oil that is used in traditional medicine and aromatherapy. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens in Mediterranean climates. Its unique appearance and aromatic properties contribute to its value in both horticulture and herbal medicine.
